snippet: President Omar Hassan al-Bashir of Sudan, who has been charged with genocide, is seeking a visa to attend the United Nations General Assembly.
abstract: Sudan's Pres Omar Hassan al-Bashir, wanted for years by International Criminal Court on charges of genocide and other crimes in the Darfur conflict, sets off growing storm of anger with his plan to attend United Nations General Assembly; has submitted visa request to United States to attend.

byline.original: By RICK GLADSTONE and ISMA'IL KUSHKUSH
byline.contributor: Rick Gladstone reported from New York, and Isma’il Kushkush from Khartoum, Sudan. Dan Bilefsky and Marlise Simons contributed reporting from Paris, and Christine Hauser from New York.

lead_paragraph: President Omar Hassan al-Bashir of Sudan, who has been charged with genocide, is seeking a visa to attend the United Nations General Assembly.

headline.main: U.S. Is Asked to Hold Sudan Leader if He Visits U.N.
headline.print_headline: U.S. Is Asked to Hold Sudan Leader if He Visits U.N.

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
keywords.name: subject
